Author: LolitaJane
Text: You're replenishing your stored glycogen, which weighs about 500g, and the water that's required to store it, which weighs about 2kg.  So no, it's not fat, it's emergency food and water storage, which is the first thing your body replenishes when you stop undereating.

Author: NewBullMoose
Text: You would have to be eating about 3,500 calories OVER maintenance (so probably at least 4,700-5,200 per day) to actually gain 5 lbs of body mass in 5 days. Itâ€™s technically possible but I doubt you really did it. Probably just water weight (especially if you ate lots of salty or carb-heavy food).
